reviewText: this is such a great documentary on chris cole and his life and challenges....we are huge skateboarding fans and love seeing the true behind the scenes of alot of these talented people ...hubby growing up in philly and new jersey has been around the skate scene and around alot of these people and the memories and greatness of these great talents like chris cole is amazing...mom and hubby approved!

Chris Cole has a superb story to tell. Like many legendary skaters, he grew up an average kid and soon fell in love with the sport. This documentary introduces you to his early life, the hard work he put in to get where he's at, and how he's influenced a generation.

Several of the chapters of the documentary are especially well-done, particularly the early parts when they go over his early life. Though, I found that the documentary lost its trajectory when it went over Love Park and Philadelphia, before moving toward the "feel good" ending at Camp Woodward. I would have liked to heard and seen more from Chris Cole's pre 20's life.
Very good story on Chris Cole, he story mad me feel like I can take over the world
It is always great to see talented people, actors, rock stars, etc. giving back.
Very entertaining and well done. Even if you are not interested in skateboarding, I recommend this because it is a human story.

This movie is really good very straight forward. Inspiring, but not smacking you over the head with cliche messages. Chris cole was very down to eart and I think everyone can relate to thinking they invented every trick at one point in time.
Since I watched it I just want to skate everyday.
